Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador have never won the Copa America but have finished fourth on two previous occasions - in 1959 and 1993.
Ecuador will enter this match off the back of successive wins, beating Bolivia and Honduras in their friendlies earlier this month.
Ecuador's Moises Caicedo is in line to win his 43rd cap in this contest, while 17-year-old Kendry Paez is also likely to be included in the starting XI.
Ecuador's Enner Valencia remains a key figure for the national side, having scored 41 times in 86 appearances.
Venezuela have not been in action since a goalless draw with Guatemala in March and have lost their last two matches against Colombia and Italy.
Venezuela's Salomon Rondon is likely to feature in the final third of the field, with Yeferson Soteldo and Jefferson Savarino also expected to play.
Ecuador are currently fifth in their 2026 World Cup qualification section, while Venezuela sit fourth.
